title: Minimun gas price ignored

labels.name: non mainnet (private networks)
labels.description: not related to mainnet features - covers privacy, permissioning, IBFT2, QBFT

body:
<!-- Have you done the following? -->
<!--   * read the Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to -->  
<!--     comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: -->
<!--     https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md -->
<!--   * Reproduced the issue in the latest version of the software -->
<!--   * Read the debugging docs: https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/HowTo/Monitor/Logging/ -->
<!--   * Duplicate Issue check:  https://github.com/search?q=+is%3Aissue+repo%3Ahyperledger/Besu -->
<!-- Note:  Not all sections will apply to all issue types. -->

### Description
I want to set the minimum gas price to 0 so I can deploy smart contracts without problems.

### Acceptance Criteria
Parameter `--min-gas-price` not ignored

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Use the command npx `quorum-dev-quickstart` to run a local besu network (`besu version` 22.10.3).
2. Deploy a smart contract to this local network.

**Expected behavior:**
To deploy the smart contract.

**Actual behavior:**
I get this error:

`ProviderError: Gas price below configured minimum gas price
    at HttpProvider.request (/home/domingo/token-erc20/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/providers/http.ts:78:19)
    at LocalAccountsProvider.request (/home/domingo/token-erc20/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/core/providers/accounts.ts:182:36)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
    at EthersProviderWrapper.send (/home/domingo/token-erc20/node_modules/@nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers/src/internal/ethers-provider-wrapper.ts:13:20)`

If I look for Besus logs:

`{"timestamp":"2023-06-02T13:06:21,722","container":"39d421c9fa71","level":"INFO","thread":"main","class":"Besu","message":"Starting Besu","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2023-06-02T13:06:24,125","container":"39d421c9fa71","level":"WARN","thread":"main","class":"Besu","message":"--min-gas-price has been ignored because --miner-enabled was not defined on the command line.","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2023-06-02T13:06:27,088","container":"39d421c9fa71","level":"INFO","thread":"main","class":"Besu","message":"
`

As you can see, `--min-gas-price` is ignored. I tried to put in the config file this instruction `miner-enabled=true` but the network does not work.

**Frequency:**
Always I try to deploy a smart contract


### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`22.10.3`]
* Java version: [`17`]
* OS Name & Version: [`WSL2`]
@matthew1001 this is similar to the config cleanup you were working on? Or did I just recall you hitting the same hurdle ðŸ˜…

I haven't raised an issue for the incorrect parameter validation yet, maybe it can be tracked under this issue? The (unrelated) config issue I've been looking at is some `TOML` files not accepted by Besu (https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/issues/5482). I'd be happy to help try and tidy up some of the validation issues being discussed here once `5482` is sorted.

Hi @matthew1001! Thank you for your reply. When I set `--miner-enabled=true`, I dont get the error related to `--miner-coinbase`, it simply doesnt run. I tried to set `--miner-enabled` and `--miner-coinbase`. When I did this, Besu didnt show me any error, but when I tried to deploy my contract, I still got `ProviderError: Gas price below configured minimum gas price`

**Logs with `--miner-enabled`**
{"timestamp":"2023-06-06T15:41:48,426","container":"4528caf09ebf","level":"INFO","thread":"main","class":"Besu","message":"Starting Besu","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2023-06-06T15:41:49,544","container":"4528caf09ebf","level":"INFO","thread":"main","class":"Besu","message":"Using jemalloc","throwable":""}


**Logs with `--miner-enabled` and `--miner-coinbase`:**
{"timestamp":"2023-06-06T15:24:25,189","container":"c4036a383b9c","level":"INFO","thread":"main","class":"Besu","message":"Starting Besu","throwable":""}
{"timestamp":"2023-06-06T15:24:28,733","container":"c4036a383b9c","level":"INFO","thread":"main","class":"Besu","message":"
####################################################################################################
                                                                                                  #
 Besu 22.10.3                                                                                     #
                                                                                                  #
 Configuration:                                                                                   #
 Network: Mainnet                                                                                 #
 Data storage: Forest                                                                             #
 Sync mode: Full                                                                                  #
 RPC HTTP APIs: EEA,WEB3,ETH,NET,TRACE,DEBUG,ADMIN,TXPOOL,PERM,QBFT                               #
 RPC HTTP port: 8545                                                                              #
                                                                                                  #
 Host:                                                                                            #
 Java: openjdk-java-11                                                                            #
 Maximum heap size: 1.87 GB                                                                       #
 OS: linux-x86_64                                                                                 #
 glibc: 2.31                                                                                      #
 Total memory: 7.46 GB                                                                            #
 CPU cores: 8                                                                                     #
                                                                                                  #

That's interesting. I've got to admit I didn't get time after working through the combination of parameters to remove the various warnings, to try deploying anything. I'll try to recreate it soon and let you know if I get the same problem you're seeing re. failed contract deployment.
Thank you Matthew! I look forward to hearing from you

I've just tried a fresh QBFT setup using a recent build from Besu `main` and it seems to be working fine with `--min-gas-price=0` set. I do still see the unexpected/erroneous warning about it being ignored:

`2023-06-08 13:51:21.529+01:00 | main | WARN  | Besu | --min-gas-price has been ignored because --miner-enabled was not defined on the command line.`

but I think that's just a misleading error message. I've tried issuing `eth_gasPrice` which is correctly returning `0x0` and I've successfully deployed a smart contract to the chain using hardhat.

This is the complete command line I've used to start the node:

`besu --data-path=data --genesis-file=../genesis.json --rpc-http-enabled --rpc-http-api=ETH,NET,QBFT,TXPOOL,ADMIN,EEA,PRIV --host-allowlist="*" --tx-pool-max-size=2048 --rpc-http-cors-origins="all" --min-gas-price=0`

@DomingoMr could you see how your Besu command line args compare to mine please? And I would suggest removing `--miner-enabled` and `--miner-coinbase` if you still have them set.
@DomingoMr did you try this? it worked for me https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/private-networks/how-to/configure/free-gas/#

Hi! @bengyles I tried that, but i cant set the `contractSizeLimit`, cause It does not appear on my config file. The rest does not work for me.

@matthew1001 I use the `quorum-dev-quickstart` that uses a docker-compose.yml. The command line used in this file is the following:
`/opt/besu/bin/besu \
      --config-file=/config/config.toml \
      --p2p-host=$$(hostname -i) \
      --rpc-http-api=EEA,WEB3,ETH,NET,TRACE,DEBUG,ADMIN,TXPOOL,PERM,${BESU_CONS_ALGO:-QBFT} \
      --rpc-ws-api=EEA,WEB3,ETH,NET,TRACE,DEBUG,ADMIN,TXPOOL,PERM,${BESU_CONS_ALGO:-QBFT} ;`
If I try to add the `--min-gas-price`  instruction, is the same as if I add on the config file.

I'm impacted by this error. I'm following this helm chart to deploy a besu component:

https://github.com/ConsenSys/quorum-kubernetes/blob/master/helm/charts/besu-node/values.yaml

This is the besu version:
```yaml
image:
  besu:
    repository: hyperledger/besu
    tag: 22.7.2
    pullPolicy: IfNotPresent
```

I'm using this script because is the official documentation, described here: https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/private-networks/tutorials/kubernetes/

As I can see, probably the release 22.7.2 has a bug that causes this ignored param (because @matthew1001 tested it on the latest release and can't reproduce the message). Can I update this helm chart to Besu 23.4.1 by simply changing the `image.besu.tag` to 23.4.1?
@alexcostars yes you should be able to just replace the tag on the image specification and set it to `23.4.1`

Hi! I have been working on this along this week and I have found a solution:

As u said @matthew1001, although logs show the warning `min-gas-price ignored`, the price is set to zero, but I still got the same error when deploying the contract.

What I had to do was to set `"zeroBaseFee": true` in the `genesis.json`,  inside "config", as @bengyles indicated (if u are using `quorum-dev-quickstart)`.  I tried to do it also with helm charts, but I do not know how to insert that line... so if anyone could help me with that, I would appreciate it. 

Anyway, I think the problem is solved.

@matthew1001, our team are working to update the helm chart.

We are trying to set `zeroBaseFee`, as indicated by @DomingoMr, but is not working. Does anyone know how to configure the help chart to include this parameter (we are following this template: https://github.com/ConsenSys/quorum-kubernetes/tree/master/helm/charts/besu-node)?

@alexcostars I think at this step in the helm deploy you can set the `zeroBaseFee` in the genesis chart:

https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/private-networks/tutorials/kubernetes/charts/#4-deploy-the-genesis-chart

e.g.

```
...
rawGenesisConfig:
  genesis:
    config:
      chainId: 1337
      zeroBaseFee: true
      algorithm:
        consensus: qbft # choose from: ibft | qbft | raft | clique
...
```

Have you tried setting it there?

I did, but It did not work.

I tried to change also `/charts/besu-genesis/values`,  and `/charts/besu-genesis/templates/genesis-job-init.yaml` and did not work.

I've raised PR https://github.com/Consensys/quorum-dev-quickstart/pull/258 on the consensys quickstart to add `zeroBaseFee` to the genesis files. Hopefully that will avoid others hitting this with the quickstart.
@alexcostars I might suggest raising a separate issue to track helm (as opposed to quickstart, which this issue was originally opened for). Is that OK with you?
@alexcostars Try to set the besu tag version to 23.4.1 and `zeroBaseFee` instruction should work

I'm closing this as https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/5669 has been merged which tidies up the warning messages around mining options when anything other than an `ethash` network is being used (so the `--min-gas-price has been ignored because --miner-enabled was not defined on the command line.` warning shouldn't show up when using QBFT/IBFT/clique networks) and https://github.com/Consensys/quorum-dev-quickstart/pull/258 has also been merged (which makes the quickstart work as a free gas chain).

If there are still issues with the helm charts and not being able to set `zeroBaseFee` let's open a new issue for that.
